book.description: 64-3JN-asv.sfm The American Standard Version of the Holy Bible (1901) Tuesday, September 12, 2006

contents.verseText: The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.
contents: The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.

contents.verseText: Beloved, I pray that in all things thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
contents: Beloved, I pray that in all things thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

contents.verseText: For I rejoiced greatly, when brethren came and bare witness unto thy truth, even as thou walkest in truth.
contents: For I rejoiced greatly, when brethren came and bare witness unto thy truth, even as thou walkest in truth.

contents.verseText: Greater joy have I none than this, to hear of my children walking in the truth.
contents: Greater joy have I none than this, to hear of my children walking in the truth.

contents.verseText: Beloved, thou doest a faithful work in whatsoever thou doest toward them that are brethren and strangers withal;
contents: Beloved, thou doest a faithful work in whatsoever thou doest toward them that are brethren and strangers withal;

contents.verseText: who bare witness to thy love before the church: whom thou wilt do well to set forward on their journey worthily of God:
contents: who bare witness to thy love before the church: whom thou wilt do well to set forward on their journey worthily of God:

contents.verseText: because that for the sake of the Name they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
contents: because that for the sake of the Name they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

contents.verseText: We therefore ought to welcome such, that we may be fellow-workers for the truth.
contents: We therefore ought to welcome such, that we may be fellow-workers for the truth.

contents.verseText: I wrote somewhat unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.
contents: I wrote somewhat unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

contents.verseText: Therefore, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he doeth, prating against us with wicked words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and them that would he forbiddeth and casteth them out of the church.
contents: Therefore, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he doeth, prating against us with wicked words: and not
content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and them that would he forbiddeth and casteth
out of the church.

contents.verseText: Beloved, imitate not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth evil hath not seen God.
contents: Beloved, imitate not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth evil hath
not seen God.

contents.verseText: Demetrius hath the witness of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, we also bear witness; and thou knowest that our witness is true.
contents: Demetrius hath the witness of all
, and of the truth itself: yea, we also bear witness; and thou knowest
that our witness is true.

contents.verseText: I had many things to write unto thee, but I am unwilling to write them to thee with ink and pen:
contents: I had many things to write unto thee, but I am unwilling to write
to thee with ink and pen:

contents.verseText: but I hope shortly to see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be unto thee. The friends salute thee. Salute the friends by name.
contents: but I hope shortly to see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace
unto thee. The friends salute thee. Salute the friends by name.
